metadata.title: CVE-2022-48891 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:regulator: da9211: Use irq handler when readyIf the system does not come from reset (like when it is kexec()), theregulator might have an IRQ waiting for us.If we enable the IRQ handler before its structures are ready, we crash.This patch fixes:[    1.141839] Unable to handle kernel read from unreadable memory atvirtual address 0000000000000078[    1.316096] Call trace:[    1.316101]  blocking_notifier_call_chain+0x20/0xa8[    1.322757] cpu cpu0: dummy supplies not allowed for exclusive requests[    1.327823]  regulator_notifier_call_chain+0x1c/0x2c[    1.327825]  da9211_irq_handler+0x68/0xf8[    1.327829]  irq_thread+0x11c/0x234[    1.327833]  kthread+0x13c/0x154

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48891` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-lowlatency - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1153-aws - 4.15.0-1153.166~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1147-gcp - 4.15.0-1147.163~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1116-oracle - 4.15.0-1116.127~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1153.166~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1147.163~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1116.127~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
